results.relevance_explanation: Bartending is not directly related to the Information Technology degree program.
results.calculation_breakdown: No start date or duration specified, assuming minimal hours. Calculating based on available information is not possible.
results.challenging_evidence: Lacks technical skills and industry relevance related to Information Technology.
results.recommendation: Provide documentation including start date and duration to determine working hours so the work experience can be re-evaluated as general training.
results.recommendation_reasoning: While the work experience lacks direct relevance to Information Technology, it provides customer service experience. Since the working hours cannot be determined, the ECTS credits cannot be reliably calculated.
results.summary_justification: The work experience does not demonstrate sufficient alignment with Information Technology degree requirements to justify professional training classification. However, general training credits can be considered if working hours are provided.
results.justification: The work experience does not meet the criteria for professional training as it is not related to the field of Information Technology. Since no start date or duration were provided, the total working hours cannot be calculated and therefore the ECTS credit evaluation is not possible. If student can provide information on the hours worked, the experience can be considered as general training
